column4: I've been on my computer for about an hour and three times, a window has popped up that says "Debconf BlackMesa", then disappears after a second or two (BlackMesa is my computer name). Does anyone know why this is happening? Is it because I am installing software?
what is the output of:  lsb_release -c
it's a terminal command, you can copy /paste to the terminal
natty
probably caused by updates.
Is there anything I can do about it? Or should I just leave it be?
just let it fly for now, if its during updates/installs then itsok, if you get it randomly then I'd review the situation
I think it is installs that I am doing
Okay, that debconf thing just popped up about 6 times after I finished installing a program...
ok let updates finish, then reboot. Use the OS as normal to see if t still happens
unzip filename
not by default
Okay, I forget if I have it installed, how would I find out if it is?
dpkg -l | grep jdk     may do it
okay, that worked. I have a few openjdk's and default-jdk
may help too http://www.multimediaboom.com/how-to-install-java-in-ubuntu-11-04-natty-narwhal-ppa/
not really no
+1 for distortion though, crank speakers rather than the app
Well, I'm on a laptop
I know about that, but I mean one that will display the temperature, then update them as they change
there is xsensors as well as some conky code which will display it
i don't really want to run it with conky, just through the command line. I guess I could just write a script
sudo sensors    will show the temps etc, you could make a script to loop it round
